formalpara.title: GCC optimization bug fix
formalpara.para: A bug in the GCC optimizer has been fixed that caused incorrect code to be generated for some cases of multiplication by a constant when compiling with -O2 or -O3.

formalpara.title: GCC wrong code fix
formalpara.para: An optimizer bug has been fixed that caused GCC to generate code with incorrect scheduling of memory reference instructions.

formalpara.title: GCC crash bug fix
formalpara.para: A GCC bug has been fixed that caused an internal compiler error when a MIPS16 function was inlined into a MIPS32 function.

formalpara.title: MIPS64 support and multilibs
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; for &csl_target_name; now provides full support for MIPS64 revision 2 processors, including new libraries for the N64 ABI (-mabi=64). Please refer to for a list of the currently-supported multilibs.

formalpara.title: Changes to included libraries
formalpara.para: Library variants built with -mfp64, -mno-float, and -mcode-readable=no have been removed from &csl_prod; for &csl_target_name;. Please refer to for a list of the currently-supported multilibs.

formalpara.title: Fix for compiler hang
formalpara.para: A bug that caused GCC to become stuck in an infinite loop in the optimizer has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Optimization bug fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that affected some programs using type-aliased assignments to pointer variables. The bug caused incorrect code to be generated when compiled with -O2 or -O3.

formalpara.title: MIPS16 register corruption fix
formalpara.para: A bug in the libgcc shared library has been fixed that caused MIPS16 functions returning floating-point values to corrupt the v0 and v1 registers. Affected programs must be re-linked.

formalpara.title: MIPS16 support and multilibs
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; now includes full support for MIPS16 code on &csl_target_name; targets. New multilibs built as MIPS16 code have been added to provide reduced code size and improved processor performance on MIPS16 targets. For details about the new libraries, refer to .

formalpara.title: MIPS16 Thread-Local Storage support added
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; now supports use of the __thread storage specifier for Thread-Local Storage (TLS) when compiling and linking with -mips16.

formalpara.title: OpenMP fix for MIPS Linux targets
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed in the OpenMP library (libgomp) that caused incorrect behavior during restart of futex system calls.

formalpara.title: MIPS16 branch bug fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that caused incorrect code to be generated for MIPS16 branches with offsets greater than 65534 or less than -65536 has been fixed.

formalpara.title: ARM VFP9-S errata workaround
formalpara.para: A compiler workaround for ARM Errata Notice GENC-010704 (760019: Canceled FDIV or FSQRT can be executed twice) has been implemented.

formalpara.title: Wrong-code bug fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that caused incorrect code to be generated for some branches with -mbranch-likely optimization enabled has been fixed.

formalpara.title: New 603 - No Graphics, 32-bit multilib
formalpara.para: A new multilib that is compatible with processors that do not implement the optional PowerPC Graphics instructions has been added. For more information, refer to .

formalpara.title: Map file name demangling bug fix
formalpara.para: GCC now properly passes the --demangle and --no-demangle options to the linker to control map file output. The default behavior on all hosts is now to demangle C++ names.

formalpara.title: Support for MCF51AG, MCF51JE and MCF51MM ColdFire processors
formalpara.para:
&csl_sgxx; now supports the Freescale MCF51AG, MCF51JE and MCF51MM families of ColdFire microcontrollers. Use the -mcpu=51ag, -mcpu=51je and -mcpu=51mm options to generate code for these devices.
CS3 board support for MCF51AG96, MCF51AG128, MCF51JE128, MCF51JE256, MCF51MM128 and MCF51MM256 microcontrollers has also been added.

formalpara.title: MIPS16 switch statement compilation fix
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused very large switch statements to be compiled incorrectly for MIPS16.

formalpara.title: Smaller exception handling tables
formalpara.para: The compiler now marks exception handling information for template functions so that the linker can remove duplicates. This also affects non-inlined inline functions.

formalpara.title: MIPS16 static data bug fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that caused static data to be accessed incorrectly from position-independent MIPS16 code in rare cases.

formalpara.title: Code generation bug fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that caused incorrect assembly code to be generated for movt instructions has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Packed volatile structure fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that resulted in incorrect code for volatile accesses to packed structure fields has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Support for MIPS M14Ke and M14Kec processors
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; now supports the MIPS M14Ke and M14Kec processors. To compile for these targets, use the -march=m14ke -mmicromips or -march=m14kec -mmicromips command-line options.

formalpara.title: Fixed-point support in big-endian mode
formalpara.para: Compiler support for fixed-point operations has been improved for big-endian ARM targets. Previously, incorrect code was generated in several cases, particularly when passing and returning fixed-point values to/from functions.

formalpara.title: Compiler crash bug fix
formalpara.para: A GCC bug has been fixed that caused internal compiler errors in some situations when generating conditional versions of floating-point operations.

formalpara.title: MIPS16 bug fix
formalpara.para: A GCC bug that caused undefined references to functions with the prefix __fn_local when compiling with -mips16 -mhard-float has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Compiler crash bug fix
formalpara.para: A GCC bug has been fixed that caused internal compiler errors when generating ARM/Thumb-2 shift operations.

formalpara.title: Improved function call profiling
formalpara.para: The compiler now supports the -finstrument-function-calls option. Please see the GCC documentation for more details.

formalpara.title: Interprocedural stack optimization.
formalpara.para: The compiler has a new experimental optimization that generates code that claims less stack space. To switch this optimization on, use -mframe-header-opt.

formalpara.title: Interprocedural register optimization.
formalpara.para: The compiler has a new experimental optimization that generates better code for functions that only call functions in the same object. To switch this optimization on, use -fuse-caller-save.

formalpara.title: Improved DSP code
formalpara.para: The compiler now makes better use of DSP accumulator registers when compiling with -mdsp or -mdspr2.

formalpara.title: Fixed-point arithmetic support
formalpara.para: Experimental compiler support has been added for fixed-point arithmetic on ARM, as described in the draft ISO/IEC technical report TR 18037. Specialized instructions defined in recent architecture versions for performing saturating arithmetic, etc. are used when available, but are not a prerequisite for using the new language features. See for further details.

formalpara.title: Inline assembly and volatile fields
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused the compiler to incorrectly reject inline asm statements referring to volatile class/struct fields with errors such as error: output number 1 not directly addressable.

formalpara.title: Variable Length Array (VLA) alignment bug
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that resulted in incorrectly aligned variable length arrays (VLA) in leaf functions has been fixed.

formalpara.title: C++ constructor bug fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that caused incorrect code for C++ constructors for some class hierarchies that use virtual inheritance and include empty classes. At runtime, the incorrect constructors resulted in memory corruption or other errors.

formalpara.title: microMIPS branches
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that caused sub-optimal branch instructions to be generated in microMIPS mode has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error with pointer casting
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that caused internal compiler errors when accessing double-word memory locations with casted pointers under ARM mode.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error under Thumb mode
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that caused internal compiler errors when generating Thumb code.

formalpara.title: Cortex-R5 support
formalpara.para: &csl_sgxx; now includes support for ARM Cortex-R5 processors. To compile for these processors, use -mcpu=cortex-r5.

formalpara.title: Unaligned access support
formalpara.para: The compiler now generates more efficient code for accessing packed data structures and for copying small blocks of unaligned data when targeting architectures that permit unaligned word/halfword accesses. This feature can be controlled by the -munaligned-access and -mno-unaligned-access options, and is enabled by default for ARMv6 processors and above, except for ARMv6-M.

formalpara.title: MIPS32r2 floating-point multiply-accumulate restrictions lifted
formalpara.para: Following clarifications to the MIPS architecture specification, GCC has been updated to allow floating-point multiply-accumulate instructions on MIPS32r2 processors in all configurations.

formalpara.title: Thumb debug information fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that resulted in incorrect debug information for Thumb code has been fixed. The incorrect information prevented single stepping through some code.

formalpara.title: Improved support for 32-bit symbols when using 64-bit ABI
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; has been improved to handle Procedure Linkage Table (PLT) entries for 32-bit function symbols when compiling for N64 ABI. Effectively, the toolchain now supports building applications with -mabi=64 -msym32 -mplt compiler options, which may improve performance of certain applications.

formalpara.title: Incorrect C++ warning fixed
formalpara.para: A bug in GCC has been fixed that caused spurious warnings about lambda expressions in C++ code that does not use them.

formalpara.title: Incorrect code for built-in comparison functions
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that sometimes caused GCC's built-in comparison functions, such as __builtin_isgreaterequal, to incorrectly raise exceptions when invoked on unordered floating-point arguments.

formalpara.title: GCC version 4.5.2
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; for &csl_target_name; is now based on GCC version 4.5.2.

formalpara.title: Array alignment for Altivec
formalpara.para: When compiling for Altivec (-maltivec option), stack-allocated arrays arrays 16 bytes or larger are now aligned to at least 16 bytes. This improves performance as Altivec instructions can be used to access them.

formalpara.title: C++ exception handling
formalpara.para: A defect in the implementation of the EH-ABI specification has been fixed. The defect affected the catching of pointer types in code generated by the ARM RealView compiler but using the &csl_sgxx; runtime libraries. The fix also retains backward compatibility with existing GCC-compiled code.

formalpara.title: GCC bug where accesses to volatile structure fields are optimized away
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed where accesses to volatile fields of a structure were sometimes incorrectly optimized away if the structure instance was defined as non-volatile.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error with NEON intrinsics
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that caused internal compiler errors when using certain NEON intrinsics.

formalpara.title: GCC code generation bug for casts to volatile types
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that sometimes caused incorrect code for references to pointers to types with volatile casts.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error fix
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused compiler crashes when optimizing comparisons of long long types.

formalpara.title: GCC fix for thread-local storage
formalpara.para: A compiler optimization bug has been fixed that affected accesses to thread-local storage. The bug resulted in assembler errors of the form symbol `.LPIC2' is already defined.

formalpara.title: GCC microMIPS code size improvement
formalpara.para: GCC has been improved to generate smaller code around function calls.

formalpara.title: GCC fixes for NEON in big-endian mode
formalpara.para: Several compiler bugs have been fixed that could lead to incorrect code when using NEON in big-endian mode. The problems only manifested when using the auto-vectorizer (enabled by default at the -O3 optimization level) with the -mvectorize-with-neon-quad option.

formalpara.title: Default software float-point libraries
formalpara.para: A defect that incorrectly caused hardware floating-point libraries to be selected for some processors without floating-point units has been corrected. GCC now uses the -mcpu option to select an appropriate floating-point library by default.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error fixes
formalpara.para: Two bugs have been fixed that caused compiler crashes in rare cases. The first bug involved code with multiple comparison operations, and the second one involved char to int conversion.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error fixes
formalpara.para: Two bugs have been fixed that caused compiler crashes in rare cases. The first bug involved code with multiple comparison operations, and the second one involved char to int conversion.

formalpara.title: Incorrect optimization fix
formalpara.para: An optimizer bug that in rare cases caused incorrect code to be generated for complex AND and OR expressions containing redundant subexpressions has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Improvements to synchronization primitives
formalpara.para:
GCC's __sync built-in functions have been improved to make better use of MIPS atomic instructions.
In addition, some of GLIBC's atomic macros have been improved to make use of the __sync built-in functions.

formalpara.title: Compiler optimization improvements
formalpara.para:
The compiler has been enhanced with a number of optimization improvements, including:
Smaller and faster code for compound conditionals.
Improved filling of branch delay slots.
Removal of superfluous sign and zero extensions.
Improved code for multiply-and-accumulate operations on ARM.
Faster code when tuning for Cortex-M series processors.

formalpara.title: GCC fixes for -fstrict-volatile-bitfields
formalpara.para: GCC now honors -fstrict-volatile-bitfields when a bitfield is not declared volatile initially, but an object including bit fields is cast to volatile. Also, a bug was fixed that caused incorrect code to be generated for some stores to volatile bit fields when -fstrict-volatile-bitfields is enabled.

formalpara.title: Floating-point code generation fix for e500
formalpara.para: An optimizer bug that sometimes caused GCC to generate incorrect code for floating-point arithmetic on e500 processors has been fixed.

formalpara.title: New __builtin_isel functions
formalpara.para: GCC now supports a family of __builtin_isel builtin functions, which expand inline into isel instructions. These new builtins are only supported on processors that support the isel instruction. For more information, please see the GCC manual.

formalpara.title: New -fstrict-volatile-bitfields option
formalpara.para:
The compiler has a new option, -fstrict-volatile-bitfields, which forces access to a volatile structure member using the width that conforms to its type.
This option is enabled by default to conform to the ARM EABI.
This option is enabled by default.
Refer to the GCC manual for details.

formalpara.title: GCC fix for duplicated symbols
formalpara.para: A GCC optimizer bug that caused multiple definitions of local symbols has been fixed. Code affected by the bug was rejected by the assembler.

formalpara.title: NEON narrowing-move instructions
formalpara.para: The compiler now supports narrowing-move instructions when auto-vectorizing for NEON. Loops accessing arrays of char or short values are now more likely to be vectorized.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error fixes
formalpara.para:
A bug has been fixed that caused the compiler to crash on code containing a typedef alias for __builtin_va_list with option -femit-struct-debug-baseonly.
This bug affected compiling the Linux kernel.
A second bug has been fixed that caused a crash when compiling code using C99 variable-length arrays.
Additionally, a compiler crash on code using 64-bit integer multiplications with NEON vectorization enabled has also been fixed.

formalpara.title: NEON code generation fix
formalpara.para: A GCC bug has been fixed that resulted in an assembler error VFP/Neon double precision register expected.

formalpara.title: Static data size improvement at -Os
formalpara.para: When optimizing for size, the compiler no longer implicitly adds padding bytes to align static and local arrays on word boundaries. This fixes static data size regressions introduced since GCC 4.4. The additional alignment is still used when optimizing for speed.

formalpara.title: Code generation improvements
formalpara.para: The compiler now generates better code for masks combined with a comparison against zero in certain cases. Additionally, it now uses conditional moves rather than branches in more situations.

formalpara.title: Improved thread-local storage access
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; now implements the TLS Descriptor access model, which provides faster access to thread-local storage from shared libraries and position-independent executables. This GCC option, which is enabled by default, additionally requires support from the dynamic loader. Code built with older versions of &csl_sgxx; continues to work with the included loader. For more information, refer to .

formalpara.title: Improved support for atomic memory builtins
formalpara.para: The compiler support for built-in atomic memory access operations on ARMv7 targets has been improved. These builtins are documented in the GCC manual.

formalpara.title: C++ locale support
formalpara.para: The C++ standard library now includes locale support. This feature is not enabled for uClibc multilibs.

formalpara.title: SH4AL-DSP libraries removed
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; for &csl_target_name; no longer includes library support for SH4AL-DSP. This change has been made at the request of Renesas. Libraries for SH4AL-DSP processors are still provided as part of &csl_sgxx; Personal, Standard, and Professional editions. Please contact &csl_sales; for information about &csl_sgxx; subscriptions.

formalpara.title: New -Wdouble-promotion warning option
formalpara.para: The compiler has a new option, -Wdouble-promotion, which enables warnings about implicit promotions of float values to double. This option is useful when compiling code for processors (such as ARM Cortex-M4) that have hardware support for single-precision floating-point arithmetic only, where unintentional use of double precision results in dramatically slower code.

formalpara.title: Thumb-2 internal compiler error fix
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused the compiler to crash when compiling Thumb-2 code using 64-bit integer arithmetic.

formalpara.title: GCC fix for reference to undefined label
formalpara.para: A bug in the optimizer that caused GCC to emit references to undefined labels has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Alignment attributes
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused the compiler to ignore alignment attributes of C++ static member variables where the attribute was present on the definition, but not the declaration.

formalpara.title: Argument passing fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that resulted in incorrect code for some functions defined with both long double and variadic (...) parameters.

formalpara.title: C++ runtime symbol visibility
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused some symbols in the C++ runtime library (libsupc++.a) to have incorrect visibility attributes.

formalpara.title: Compiler optimization improvements
formalpara.para:
The compiler has been enhanced with a number of optimization improvements, including:
More efficient assignment for structures containing bitfields.
Better code for initializing C++ arrays with explicit element initializers.
Improved logic for eliminating/combining redundant comparisons in code with nested conditionals.
Better selection of loop variables, resulting in fewer temporaries and more efficient register usage.
More optimization of references to globals in position-independent code.
Various Thumb code generation improvements.
Better code when constant addresses are used as arguments to inline assembly statements.
Better code for copying small constant strings.
Improved tuning for Cortex-M4 processors.
Cortex-A9 specific tuning for VFP and NEON instructions.
Use of more NEON features.

formalpara.title: MIPS 34Kn support
formalpara.para: &csl_sgxx; now includes support for MIPS 34Kn processors. To compile for these processors, use -march=34kn.

formalpara.title: Preprocessor symbols for floating-point calling convention
formalpara.para: Built-in preprocessor symbols __ARM_PCS and __ARM_PCS_VFP are now defined to indicate the current floating-point calling convention.

formalpara.title: Support for AppliedMicro Titan (APM83xxx) cores
formalpara.para: &csl_sgxx; has been enhanced to emit code optimized for AppliedMicro Titan (APM83xxx) cores, selectable with GCC's -mcpu=titan command-line option.

formalpara.title: naked attribute semantics
formalpara.para: The naked function attribute now also implies the noinline and noclone attributes. This fixes bugs resulting from invalid optimizations of functions with this attribute.

formalpara.title: Optimizer improvements
formalpara.para: When optimizing for speed, the compiler now uses improved heuristics to limit certain types of optimizations that may adversely affect both code size and speed. This change also makes it possible to produce better code when optimizing for space rather than speed.

formalpara.title: Default setting for MIPS16 interlinking
formalpara.para: MIPS16 interlinking is now disabled by default except when compiling for microMIPS. Interlinking carries a performance penalty and is only required for microMIPS targets.

formalpara.title: microMIPS and MIPS16 diagnostic
formalpara.para: The compiler now reports an error if the options -mmicromips and -mips16 are both specified.

formalpara.title: Stack corruption bug fix
formalpara.para: A bug in GCC has been fixed that caused stack corruption in functions with the interrupt attribute.

formalpara.title: GCC bug fix for push multiple instruction generation
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused GCC to generate incorrect push multiple instructions, causing an assembler warning register range not in ascending order.

formalpara.title: C++ array initializer optimization
formalpara.para: The compiler now generates better code for some non-constant array initializations in C++.

formalpara.title: Support for MIPS 1004K cores
formalpara.para: &csl_sgxx; now includes basic compiler and assembler support for MIPS 1004K cores. Use the -march=1004kc (integer cores), -march=1004kf2_1 (half-speed FPU), -march=1004kf1_1 (full-speed FPU), or -march=1004kf (alias for 1004kf2_1) command-line options.

formalpara.title: Optimized software floating-point routines
formalpara.para: The software floating-point emulation routines used by GCC when linking with -msoft-float have been updated. The new routines provide significant speed increases.

formalpara.title: Precision improvement with vectorization enabled
formalpara.para: The GCC auto-vectorizer no longer uses NEON floating-point instructions unless the -funsafe-math-optimizations option (implied by -ffast-math) is specified. This is because NEON hardware does not fully support the IEEE 754 standard for floating-point arithmetic. In particular, very small quantities may be flushed to zero.

formalpara.title: GCC version 4.5.1
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; for &csl_target_name; is now based on GCC version 4.5.1. For more information about changes from GCC version 4.4 that was included in previous releases, see http://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-4.5/changes.html.
